Hard to believe itâ€™s been 3 years since Speed Training for Hockey was released. 

When @fitness_pollenator and I sat down to map out the book, our goal was to put together a comprehensive resource that details all of the factors that can improve a playerâ€™s speed, written specifically for youth players, parents, and coaches. 

We included a 12-week off-season training program to both illustrate how all the pieces fit together into a cohesive training plan, and to provide readers with a program they can follow to start making immediate improvements. We also included a comprehensive video database of all the exercises referenced in the book, so readers know exactly how each exercise should be performed. 

Over the last 3 years, weâ€™ve received great feedback about Speed Training for Hockey from players, parents, coaches, performance specialists, and rehab professionals alike. 

âœ… If youâ€™re interested in grabbing a copy, you can find the book on Amazon, or check out http://SpeedTrainingforHockey.com (which also has more information about the book). 

âœ… If you already have a copy, feel free to share your thoughts about the book in the comments section below, or tag a friend that you think would benefit from grabbing a copy. 

ğŸ”¥ We appreciate all your support over the last 3 years, and look forward to hearing from more players about the results they get from using the Speed Training for Hockey program this off-season!

ğŸ’ The Winners ğŸ’

â€œSit in a boat. Tell lies. Catch no fish.â€

The third and final book in the Beartown series did not disappoint. I am a person who has liked only these three Fredrik Bachman books out of all the ones Iâ€™ve read, but I love them enough to make up for the others. 

Set two years after the second book, things really pick up almost where they left off. Hockey, love, hate, addiction, rivalry, family, loyalty, lifeâ€¦so many things. There are so many characters and POVs here, but theyâ€™re all well known and developed. The suspense Bachman creates a bit of a mystery throughout, even though thatâ€™s not the point at all. 

I donâ€™t care anything about hockey, but I love these books even though thatâ€™s what they are centered around. 

â€œWe are the bears! The bears from Beartown!â€ ğŸ»

Whatâ€™s your favorite sport? I like to play soccer best, but I love watching football.

#readmorebooks #beartown #thewinners #hockey #hockeybook #favorite #bookseries #thebearsfrombeartown

Book #33 of 2022: Beartown 
Pages: 430
Fiction/ Sports
â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸/5

The small town of Beartown has lost so much over the years. It was built on hockey and somehow still stands for it. Every person in the town bleeds the colors, goes to every game, and has all of their hopes on their junior national team winning the national championship this year to put their town back on the map! This could get them sponsors, jobs and be everything this town needs and more! However, with having a great team comes great pressure on these young men. After a huge win that puts the boys further into the tournament, a violent act is committed that will leave a young girl traumatized. **Trigger warning- rape\violence** When she comes forward, no one is safe, no suspect is left unquestioned and the town is torn apart. 

This one really tugged at my heartstrings. The pressures of being a teenager, finding yourself, fitting in, being successful, being a good family member, â€œmaking itâ€ and more were all touched upon in ways that matter in this book. As a teacher, coach and former division one athlete I have seen what certain pressures of society do to teenagers. This is an important read for everyone! I will be continuing this series ASAP! 

Read it and see what you think!! 

Happy reading! ğŸ¤“ğŸ“šâœ¨
-Bookwormbfigss

Always Only You  Chloe Lieseâ£
Pub date: AUGUST 4THâ£
â£
â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ğŸ’«â£
â£
Chloe Liese is literally one of the most gifted writers I've ever had the pleasure of reading! Always Only You is the second book in the Bergman Brother's series and it gave me ALL the feels! This #ownvoices novel gives us a strong, independent, and genuine autistic main character, Frankie and a sexy yet sensitive hockey stud Ren. There are so many laugh out loud moments, sweet little pieces that melt your heart, and a peek inside the beautiful mind of an autistic person. So much of this book brought a smile to my face and really opened my mind. I loved their sweet romance and will read a grocery list if Chloe Liese writes it! ğŸ˜‚â£
â£

ARC REVIEW: THE WINNERS BY FREDRIK BACKMAN

WOW, did it take me a LONG time to finish this one or what?!

Clocking in at a whopping 688 pages (although I read it on my e-reader!), the third book in the Beartown series took me nearly two weeks to finish (my reading time's been really limited lately!!).

Backman is definitely an auto-buy author for me although Anxious People sort of missed the mark and I am definitely a BIG Beartown fan, so I was really excited for The Winners.  It was a bit slow to start and at times I felt like it dragged a bit (I mean 688 pages is a REALLY long book!!), but I loved reading all about my favorite characters (Amat, Alicia, Sune, Kira, Maya, Bobo) and meeting new characters too.

The book came to a tidy-ish end, but I'd LOVE to see a new book or series focused on the WOMEN of Beartown - Alicia, Tess, Hannah, Kira, Maya, etc., etc., etc!  These women are so strong and have so much to offer readers.  Perhaps we'll see them again some day!?!!?!

The Winners releases September 27, 2022.  Thank you to @netgalley and @atriabooks for my review copy.

About the Author -

Stan Walchuk Jr. is a biologist, teacher, award winning filmmaker, and writer. He is the author of the National Best Seller, the CORDILLERA! Expedition, an amazing 1000-mile wilderness horse expedition across the North American mountain system. The CORDILLERA! Movie earned Stan Best Documentary and Best Producer Awards. He has written more than fifty articles for Canadian magazines. Stan describes life as â€˜hockey and horsesâ€™. 

Stan is the consummate hockey dad, hockey manager, and student of the game. Together with wife Marlene, daughter Aaron, and hockey son Dylan, they lived a truly unique life in hockey.

i love nathaniel hawkins. nathan. nate. hawkins. cap. heâ€™s an icon, heâ€™s a legend, and he is the moment. and before you say anything, i ALSO loved anastasia allen. stas. stassie. a self help queen. i went in blind to this book, all i knew was it was about hockey, ice skating, and that it had spice. sign me up, right?

but i didnâ€™t really expect to like it as much as i did. i thought it was going to be just another romcom, but as i read this (in one sitting), it had me blushing and gasping and insulting some characters from beginning to end. i also loved that the secondary characters did not feel secondary at all and contributed to the main characters story as the book progressed. one thing i will say, though, is that despite that thereâ€™s a lot of tension between the main characters, i didnâ€™t see a lot of chemistry as things started off. 

i definitely recommend this, but check the trigger warnings as it is 18+.

ğŸ’Isnâ€™t It Bromantic?ğŸ’ 
Rating: 4.5 â­ï¸
â€”
Moving up this review so I can gush about how much I loved this sweet and cheesy book â˜ºï¸I know this is part of the Bromance Book Club Series (which Iâ€™ve just put in an order for books 1-3 and Iâ€™ve pre-ordered #5), so Iâ€™m not very familiar with the other characters, but you can easily get through this without knowing them. But I can already tell that my favourite book club bro is the big softie, Vlad Konnikov aka â€œThe Russianâ€ ğŸ˜ğŸ§¸ He is the ultimate teddy bear and goes against the typical tough-guy-hockey-bro stereotype. I love that he was such a hopeless romantic and I rooting so hard for him and Elena throughout the whole book. I really enjoyed the friends-to-lovers and marriage of convenience tropes at play and the plenty of cheesy moments scattered throughout the book. It was a nice change to read about sensitive male characters for once. The BBC guys are mostly stereotypical macho guys: Pro athletes, famous singer, etc but what really got me was how sweet, supportive, emotional, and ride-or-die these guys were for each other. I canâ€™t wait to read the rest of this series. Truly a feel good book â™¥ï¸

Torniamo alla serie Slayers Hockey per il secondo libro.
Ho divorato questo libro in un giorno e l'ho amato quasi quanto la storia di Vaughn e Allie. Detto questo, non credo che Mira avrebbe potuto scrivere la storia in modo diverso, e ciÃ² per cui le do i miei applausi Ã¨ il fatto che non l'ha trascinata fuori, o ha lasciato che prendesse il sopravvento sulla storia di Quinn e George in generale.

La storia segue Quinn e George, due persone che fanno parte dello stesso gruppo di amici. Dopo l'incontro, Quinn (uno spudorato playboy e giocatore professionista di hockey) viene immediatamente affascinato da George, e inizia a inseguirla... ma lei non vuole saperne di lui. Ãˆ combattuta tra la chimica che si accende tra loro e il passato che dimostra quanto siano sbagliati l'uno per l'altro. Quando George alla fine cede al (considerevole) fascino di Quinn, tutte le scommesse sono chiuse.
Ho davvero apprezzato il modo in cui lâ€™autrice ha gestito il passato da playboy di Quinn.
Il tipo di libro che Ã¨ facile da leggere in una sola volta, Ã¨ una storia d'amore ma anche di crescita personale.

Un libro da 4 â­ï¸su 5
